Package org.neo4j.gis.spatial.index.curves

Interface SpaceFillingCurveConfiguration

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PartialOverlapConfiguration, StandardConfiguration
    public interface SpaceFillingCurveConfiguration
    These settings define how to optimize the 2D (or 3D) to 1D mapping of the space filling curve. They will affect the number of 1D ranges produced as well as the number of false positives expected from the 1D index. The ideal performance depends on the behaviour of the underlying 1D index, whether it costs more to have more 1D searches, or have more false positives for post filtering.

    • Method Detail

      • stopAtThisDepth

        boolean stopAtThisDepth​(double overlap,
                        int depth,
                        int maxDepth)
        Decides whether to stop at this depth or recurse deeper.
        Parameters:
        overlap - the overlap between search space and the current extent
        depth - the current recursion depth
        maxDepth - the maximum depth that was calculated to recurse to,
        Returns:
        if the algorithm should recurse deeper, returns false; if the algorithm should stop at this depth, returns true

      • maxDepth

        int maxDepth​(Envelope referenceEnvelope,
             Envelope range,
             int nbrDim,
             int maxLevel)
        Decide how deep to recurse at max.
        Parameters:
        referenceEnvelope - the envelope describing the search area
        range - the envelope describing the indexed area
        nbrDim - the number of dimensions
        maxLevel - the depth of the spaceFillingCurve
        Returns:
        the maximum depth to which the algorithm should recurse in the space filling curve.

      • initialRangesListCapacity

        int initialRangesListCapacity()
        Returns:
        the size to use when initializing the ArrayList to store ranges.
